summary: An email from an FBI Special Agent to colleagues regarding investigative leads on Jeffrey Epstein's travel. The agent reports contacting St. Thomas Jet Center and an air traffic controller named Pat, who indicated an employee named Hatch handled Epstein's helicopter, but the company declined to comment.

persons.name: Pat
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI Special Agent; provided information suggesting an employee at St. Thomas Jet Center dealt with Epstein's helicopter.

persons.name: Hatch
persons.role: Employee at St. Thomas Jet Center
persons.context: Identified through the investigation as potentially having dealt with Jeffrey Epstein's helicopter operations at the St. Thomas Jet Center.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation concerns his travel, specifically his helicopter, which was reportedly handled by an employee at St. Thomas Jet Center.

connections.description: Hatch, an employee at St. Thomas Jet Center, is believed to have dealt with Epstein's helicopter, indicating a business/service relationship.
Pat, the air traffic controller, provided information to the FBI agent that led to the identification of Hatch as someone who dealt with Epstein's helicopter.

events.title: FBI Agent's investigative update email
events.description: An FBI Special Agent emails colleagues about leads regarding Jeffrey Epstein's helicopter travel, specifically contact with St. Thomas Jet Center and an air traffic controller.

keyFacts: An FBI agent was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's travel, specifically his helicopter use, as of August 2019.
An air traffic controller named Pat was interviewed and provided a lead pointing to an employee named Hatch at St. Thomas Jet Center.
St. Thomas Jet Center, when contacted, stated 'no comment' and refused to confirm any information regarding Epstein, indicating a lack of cooperation.
The agent suggests the possibility of needing a subpoena to compel information from the jet center.
